intro: Nemophila crambeoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, sky-blue flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture.
